intro: Inga manabiensis, commonly known as the Manabí inga, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. The seeds are enclosed in pods and can be dispersed by animals, contributing to its ecological role in forest ecosystems.
